pros: Sense of meaning gained through work

review_title: A great team to work with.
pros: A brilliant and supportive team. Good training. Lots of things to learn. A great way to build your laboratory skillset. The job was always super interesting. Rotation of in-lab duties kept work from becoming stale. Flexi-time (whilst I worked there). Daily briefing/catch up with the whole team. Well organised.
cons: Underpaid. Underfunded by the gov. Understaffed at the time I worked there. Some job progression but slow.

pros: Easy to reach by public transport
cons: Bullying in most departments, not much parking available, made to feel worthless

pros: Working with nice people in a good team.
cons: What I get paid for my level of skill and experience is too little! If I lived elsewhere, I’d be paid a lot more for my years of experience!

review_title: Only apply if you are female
pros: Currently working in a good team
cons: Blocked in every appraisal from career development for over 11 years. Despite introducing cost savings to the NHS saving thousands of pounds and producing work that is 60 to 95% faster than my colleagues still can't get promoted - probably because I'm a white english male and 98% of all staff are female. Abused by the public every day in life either by phone or in person. With one exception, management don't care and don't listen to ideas on streamlining and improving systems that haven't been updated since 1998. When policies do change managers don't tell staff but they will tell you if the boiler breaks down in the hospital thats 66 miles away! Never been so stressed doing a job in my life and I previously worked front line for the Police.

job_title: Immunisation Nurse in Darlington, North East England, England
pros: Staff really lovely to work with
cons: Lack of information given to nurses

pros: Great place to work part time
cons: cant think of any at all
Staffing issues can be a problem at times

job_title: Jan Atkinson in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: Great trust to work for. Has a great ethos of commitment; passion and respect in providing services for patients, the community and staff.
cons: The only downside is my daily commute of 66 miles - but I choose to work here.

review_title: Management don't understand care staff needs
job_title: Care Support Worker in North Yorkshire, England
pros: Small friendly local hospital, close to centre of Harrogate
cons: Managers are basically 'yes' people and are forever putting policies in place which have a major impact on front line staff, without ever actually finding out if the policy works in practice! Infuriating and often at the expense of staff moral

pros: Good team to work with good opportunities to study
cons: Not many spring to mind, employees can be quite aggressive but that is probably true of any payroll job

pros: friendly atmosphere with kind and helpful staff
cons: no onsite parking and limited parking
